page.title: 17LETHAM HILL CRAFTS
page.content: LETHAM HILL CRAFTS There has been a smithy at Letham hill since 1750.The present smithy is run by Mr.N.C.Smith.His two sons work with him.In the forge they make gates,fire grates and wrought iron work,metal turning and light engineering.In the workshop they make spinning wheels, selected items of furniture,turned items and toys.Woollen garments are made on the spinning wheels and sold to th public as well as balls of wool.Some unusual items made in the forge were replicas of medieval furniture dated around 1390 for a Northen Peel Tower.
